thinking.disposable_income: Kenwood shows significant income diversity with 45% making under $50K and 33.2% making over $100K. Median income is $58,052, suggesting moderate disposable income but with many residents sensitive to cost increases
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the income distribution and average household size of 1.8, many households have limited discretionary spending power. Higher taxes and fees would impact the 45% lower-income residents significantly
thinking.accessibility: 33.1% have no vehicle, 50.3% have one vehicle. Transit usage is significant at 23.1%, while 40.1% drive alone. Good balance of transit and driving needs to be maintained
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Need to balance transit affordability for no-car households (33.1%) while maintaining service quality. 2. Lower sales tax preferred due to large lower-income population. 3. Moderate driving fees acceptable as 40.1% drive alone and could help fund transit. 4. Lower transit fares prioritized to help transit-dependent residents. 5. Proposals balancing improved transit times without excessive costs ranked highest
